column2:
A field overgrown with very large plants, Herbivores must be scarce for some reason or another!

Sending a survivor with a high Combat or Farming skill will improve the hunting results.

I can see a pasture frequented by herbivores!

It could prove to be a good hunting ground, so I'll jot down this location for future visits.
Select someone with Combat skill above 0!
The ground is frozen and no animals come to graze.
A pack of predators has been killing the herbivores. They are scared to visit the pasture for a while.

I visited the pasture, only to find just a couple of animals grazing there.

I had just found a good ambush spot when I spotted a predator preparing to do pretty much what I was planning to.
We can attack one while it's concentrated on the hunt, or take the kill from it.
low Combat skill; high risk of injury
high Combat skill; low risk of injury
low Farming skill; high risk of injury
high Farming skill; low risk of injury
Leave it be, it's not worth the risk.
Leave it be. It has to feed too.

I trapped the predator! I actually did it! - laid out torches to drive anything else away.

After a few hours and some relatively easy to collect meat, I was able to teach it some basic commands.
We now have a new friend.

I laid a trap, but it still must have had my scent on it too much.
That being said, after a few hours a weaker predator finally fell for the lure.

It was surprisingly very food motivated, and it quickly learned I am better alive than dead!
Weird shrieking noises have been heard from this direction.

A spike-tailed insect has made a small lair between some rocks. It looks to be alone... for now.

This might be a good chance to observe its kind from a safe distance.
Observe away! It may be useful.
It would've been better to kill it, but... Just come back.
No need to know anything about it - kill it!
low Combat skill; high risk of injury
No need to know anything about it - kill it!
high Combat skill; low risk of injury
I wonder if I can convince it to come home with me?
low Combat and Farming skill; high risk of injury
I'm sure I can get it to like me
high Combat and Farming skill; low risk of injury

I managed to lure one away from the beaten path.
After a few morsels of super salted meat, I was able to show myself to it.

It must have enough intelligence to realize I can make them, and it can't.
Because it even followed me onto the Balloon back home!

After some difficulty (And a wound or two) I managed to lure only one creature away.
A few nuggets of super salted meat, I chanced showing myself.

After a brief "discussion" (And spike in my leg), I managed to convey that I can make it more meat.
So even though I'm limping back, I have a live trophy!
The source of the loud bang should be somewhere around here.

I tried to gently break an animal out of it's stupor.... only to be met with aggression!

Unfortunately, I was quite close to the thing... so I'm quite hurt.

I barely escaped with my life!

I tried to gently break an animal out of it's stupor.
Food was placed in a line away from the site, to hopefully distract it.

Unfortunately, it instead ran off.... so I selected the next best candidiate.

That one obliged, and I got it alone feeling relatively safe.
After a quick training session, it was listening to commands enough to bring it home!

I tried to gently break an animal out of it's stupor.
Food was placed in a line away from the site, to hopefully distract it.

Thankfully it obliged, and I got it alone feeling relatively safe.
After a quick training session, it was listening to commands enough to bring it home!

As I landed, I found animals in scattered positions.
When I started walking around, none of them seemed to notice me.

Whatever happened, it must have put these things into a stupor!
These would make for easy hunting, or I can try and safely tame one for our base.
Slaughter some and bring back their meat
High Farming skill, low risk of injury
Low Farming skill, moderate risk of injury

A field that is well grazed, it must be safer for herbivores here!

Sending a survivor with high Combat or Farming skill will improve the hunting results.
I'm witnessing another eerie mist gliding through the jungle. Its behavior is far from ordinary, it's as if it's leading me somewhere.

The herd seemed quite invested in not letting me get any of them...
Worst case, they fought back!

I left before I could suffer any major wounds.
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

The herd seemed quite invested in not letting me get any of them...
Worst case, they fought back!

I left before I could suffer any major wounds.

I set a diversion and the herd took the bait.
They started running away, and I managed to trip the stragglers.

As I was butchering and cleaning the body, a very eerie calm descended....
Regardless we now have some food for the colony!
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

The herd seemed quite invested in not letting me get any of them...
Worst case, they fought back!

They caught me and made sure to give me many solid wounds....
I'm lucky to escape with my life!
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

There are some very mild mannered quadrupedal animals in the area!

Today there seems to be a larger than normal grouping of creatures slightly larger than me, with one or two humps on it's back.
How should I proceed?
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.

After a few hits, they calmed down and let me drop food for them.

Multiple feedings later, one of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, they where initially quite skeptical.

I dropped food for them and made sure to back off.

After multiple feedings later, a few of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.
After about 20 seconds of not fighting back, I had enough and quickly left.

No idea what got into them..... but we will need to come back later!
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.

After a few hits, they calmed down and let me drop food for them.

Multiple feedings later, one of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, they where initially quite skeptical.

I dropped food for them and made sure to back off.

After multiple feedings later, a few of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.
After about 20 seconds of not fighting back, I had enough and quickly left.

No idea what got into them..... but we will need to come back later!
low Combat skill; high risk of injury
high Combat skill; low risk of injury
Just leave, that creature doesn't sound useful
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

There is a herd of rather portly four legged creatures here today.
Their noses are round and quite long....

How should I proceed?
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.

After a few hits, they calmed down and let me drop food for them.

Multiple feedings later, one of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, they where initially quite skeptical.

I dropped food for them and made sure to back off.

After multiple feedings later, a few of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, they approached right back!
But as they started to smell me, something must have spooked them.

Because all of a sudden I learned that they have tusks in their mouth!

No idea what got into them..... but I managed to get away with my life
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

When I approached the herd, their initial reaction was to defend its members.

After a few hits, they calmed down and let me drop food for them.

Multiple feedings later, one of these creatures seemed quite attached to me!

When I approached the herd, they approached right back!
Not sure how something so trusting is still alive, but that's a problem for another day.

A few bites of food and some scratches later, and a few are coming home with me!

When I approached the herd, they approached right back!
But as they started to smell me, something must have spooked them.

Because all of a sudden I learned that they have tusks in their mouth!

No idea what got into them..... but I managed to get away with my life
low Combat skill; high risk of injury
high Combat skill; low risk of injury
Just leave, that creature doesn't sound useful
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

There is a herd of bipedal scaled... animals?
It's hard to tell if these things are cold or hot blooded....

But I do recognize their teeth as sharp and carnivorous...
Odd they aren't hunting the other species in the area

How should I proceed?
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

The herd spread out when they first detected me.
And immediately started surrounding me. 

They did not like it when I tried to maneuver away from the surrounding....
After a few puncture wounds, they hit my pack.
This food thankfully distracted them, and let me convince one I am a friend

So we have one of these coming home with us.

The herd spread out when they first detected me.
And they started to try and surround me. 

They must have deemed me not a threat, because they backed down after a tense staring session.

I offered them both meat and vegetables, and they reacted quite positively.
We now have a few of them coming home!

When I approached the herd, they responded with immediate aggression!

Their fangs and behavior told me they are quite quick to defending themselves!

Thankfully I tossed what food I had, and it distracted them enough for me to get away.
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

When I approached the herd, they responded with immediate aggression!

Their fangs and behavior told me they are quite quick to defending themselves!

Thankfully I tossed what food I had, and it distracted them enough for me to get away.

And they started to try and surround me. 

They must have deemed me not a threat, because they backed down after a tense staring session.

We now have a few of them coming home!

After a few puncture wounds, they hit my pack.
This food thankfully distracted them, and let me convince one I am a friend

So we have one of these coming home with us.
low Combat skill; high risk of injury
high Combat skill; low risk of injury
Just leave, that creature doesn't sound useful
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

As I touched down, I found many many giant birds chasing the regular inhabitants.

The birds themselves appeared to be in different stages of malnourishment, and they should be quite easy to hunt or tame.
What should I do?
low Farming skill; high risk of injury

It was quite easy to get the attention of one of the birds, and from the look in it's eyes it wanted blood.

I did my best to distract it with some of my food, but it seems to lack intelligence to tell that a better meal was right next to it.....

In between it's aggressively pecking of my chest, I shoved my food into it's mouth and that seemed to calm it.

A few morsels later, and now I have a new friend.

It was quite easy to get the attention of one of the birds.
I managed to pick one that seemed to have eaten recently.

Thanks to that, I was able to immediately direct it to some food I had placed on the ground.
It took a few tries for it to recognize the non-moving thing as food..... it finally seemed to understand.

A Gujo who has been successful in its hunt randomly saw my new friend, and in it's.... infinite wisdom, decided to follow along.

Apparently because of their lack of intelligence, I now have new friends coming home with me

Well I got ones attention......
One extremely aggressive, starving, and quick bird.

It feels like I am now 20 kilos lighter.... but alive.
We should be quite cautious with this species in the future.
low Farming skill; high risk of injury
